item.dc:creator: TheeGoatPig
item.description:
hercule poirots nutsack:

Watchin The Lost World (1960) some lizards w/ shit glued onto them are fightin and its freakin awesome. cgi ruined cinema

I was watching Brazil the other day, and thinking about how Terry Gilliam made one of the strangest movies, that is also one of the strangest looking, and he did it all without any CGI getting in the way. It’s all puppets, claymation and shit.

item.title: Watch a movie!! Watch a movie!!!!
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
Me and some pals willingly paid to see Princess and the Frog. I swear we were the only ones that enjoyed the damn thing, all the little kids sat there staring at the screen while their parents sat there staring at their kids.

The animation ripped my dick off and glued it back of with it’s not-that-bad soundtrack, then stuck it in the ass that was the plot.

The cajun firefly and negroid alligator were awesome, too.

Also it had KEITH DAVID :retard:

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: TheeGoatPig
item.description:
Garcian Smith:

A few little bits here and there, but the biggest part is the introduction of Tales of the Black Freighter, spattered within the actual narrative of the film. Surprisingly, it works quite well.

I thought that was the version that I bought originally, and was quite upset to find out (just now ) that I have to buy it again.

item.title: Watch a movie!! Watch a movie!!!!
item.dc:creator: JohnKiller118
item.description:
On Christmas Eve I went to see “A Christmas Carol” with the family.
Very well directed and great CGI.

I also beat Metal Gear Solid 4 (which some people consider a movie for some god damn reason.)

Garcian Smith:

I also recently watched Watchmen: Ultimate Cut. Definitely the best version to watch if you have 3 and a half hours to spare.

Shit. What’s added to the film that wasn’t in the Director’s Cut?

Read full topic
item.source: Watch a movie!! Watch a movie!!!!

item.title: Watch a movie!! Watch a movie!!!!
item.dc:creator: Garcian_Smith
item.description:
Psyborg:

I know this is a stupid complaint, but the subtitles in the theatrical release were so much better than the ones on the DVD release it’s almost embarrassing. I don’t know why they decided to change it from ‘good writing’ to ‘bad english fansubs’

I watched a version of it with fansubs - so I think it was as accurate as possible. Didn’t dent my enjoyment of it, so they must have been right. I think.

I also recently watched Watchmen: Ultimate Cut. Definitely the best version to watch if you have 3 and a half hours to spare.

Read full topic
